intro: Calpurnia reflexa, commonly known as the African glorybower, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the dry season, making it an important source of nectar for pollinators. Calpurnia reflexa is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its use in traditional medicine.
